subject: p13896515
History: Shortness of breath and suspected congestive heart failure.
Findings: PA and lateral upright chest radiographs were reviewed in comparison to multiple prior studies dating back to. Post-sternotomy wires are unremarkable. The patient is after CABG. Heart size and mediastinum are stable. Diffuse interstitial opacities most likely correspond to chronic interstitial changes and unlikely to represent evidence of congestive heart failure. Questionable enlargement of the left hilus cannot be excluded. Assessment of the patient with chest CT might be considered on a non-emergent basis.
